title: How to Set a Keyboard Shortcut to Open Mac Apps

steps.title: Press and hold ⌘ Command.
steps.content: Press and hold ⌘ Command . In order to set a keyboard shortcut to open an app, you'll need to create a new Service in Automator.

steps.title: Press Space once.
steps.content: Press Space once. Doing so will bring up Spotlight search.

steps.title: Type in "Automator."
steps.content: Type in "Automator."

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: With the Automator app selected, click File.
steps.content: With the Automator app selected, click File . It's at the top left corner of the menu bar.

steps.title: Click New.
steps.content: Click New .

steps.title: Click the "Quick Action" icon.
steps.content: Click the "Quick Action" icon. It looks like a cog.

steps.title: Click Choose.
steps.content: Click Choose .

steps.title: Navigate to the service input settings.
steps.content: Navigate to the service input settings. They're the drop-down menus at the top of the window.

steps.title: Click the "Service receives selected" drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the "Service receives selected" drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click no input.
steps.content: Click no input .

steps.title: Click Actions.
steps.content: Click Actions . It's at the top left of the Service window. The list of available actions should be displayed in a scroll bar underneath the search window.

steps.title: Use the scroll bar to find "Launch Application."
steps.content: Use the scroll bar to find "Launch Application."

steps.title: Click and drag "Launch Application" to the right side.
steps.content: Click and drag "Launch Application" to the right side. A drop-down menu will appear under the newly added "Launch Application" action.

steps.title: Click the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click on an app.
steps.content: Click on an app.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . It's at the top left of the menu bar.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save .

steps.title: Type in a name for your service.
steps.content: Type in a name for your service. This is what you'll use to assign the keyboard shortcut, so make it something memorable!

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save .

steps.title: Click the Apple icon.
steps.content: Click the Apple icon. It's at the top left corner of the menu bar.

steps.title: Click System Preferences.
steps.content: Click System Preferences .

steps.title: Click the "Keyboard" icon.
steps.content: Click the "Keyboard" icon.

steps.title: Click Shortcuts.
steps.content: Click Shortcuts .

steps.title: Click Services.
steps.content: Click Services . It's on the menu on the left pane of the Shortcuts window.

steps.title: Scroll to find your newly created service.
steps.content: Scroll to find your newly created service. The list of services is located on the right side of the window.

steps.title: Click on your service to select it.
steps.content: Click on your service to select it.

steps.title: Click Add Shortcut.
steps.content: Click Add Shortcut .

steps.title: Type in your custom keyboard shortcut.
steps.content: Type in your custom keyboard shortcut. Make sure that you enter a unique shortcut, meaning that the keyboard combination is not already designated to perform another task.

steps.title: Click the red "x" button.
steps.content: Click the red "x" button.

steps.title: Click on your desktop.
steps.content: Click on your desktop.

steps.title: Enter your new keyboard shortcut.
steps.content: Enter your new keyboard shortcut. Your newly assigned shortcut will open the app!
